subject: Quikscript in the ConScript Unicode Registry: Joining
msgSnippet: I m polishing up a proposal to put Quikscript in the ConScript Unicode Registry starting at U+E650 and continuing on for three blocks; it s meant to document
messageBody:
I'm polishing up a proposal to put Quikscript in the ConScript Unicode Registry starting at U+E650 and continuing on for three blocks; it's meant to document existing practice and get angled parentheses someplace other than on U+0028 and U+0029. A _very_ preliminary version is available at <http://www.frogorbits.com/qs/csur.html>.

Elsewhere someone mentioned that it'd be nice to get at least some of the 'fancy' features codified — what letters connect to what, when it's a good idea to use the upside-down NO, and so forth. Would information like this — generally patterned on Unicode 6.2's discussion of Arabic starting on page 257 of <http://www.unicode.org/versions/Unicode6.2.0/ch08.pdf> — be appropriate in a ConScript proposal, or is it best kept elsewhere? I've just got a full copy of Glyphs, and I'm still trying to guess at what would be possible with what.
